chapter.title: ⪪ Server Configuration
chapter.para: You can use the &yast; module ⪪ Server Configuration for the initial and overall configuration. The ⪪ Server configures mirroring credentials, sets database passwords and e-mail addresses for ⪪ reports, sets the ⪪ job schedule, and activates or deactivates the ⪪ service.
To configure ⪪ with ⪪ Server Configuration, follow these steps:

step.para: To start ⪪ Server Configuration with the text (ncurses) interface, run the yast smt-server command as &rootuser;.

To activate ⪪, check the Enable Subscription Management Tool Service (SMT) option in the Customer Center Access tab. If you want to disable ⪪, uncheck this option. For more information about activating ⪪ with &yast;, see

In the Customer Center Access tab, set and test credentials for the ν (Novell Update) service. Correct credentials are necessary to enable mirroring from ν and determine the products that should be mirrored. Also set the e-mail address used for the registration and the URL of your ⪪ server. For more information, see .
In the Database and Reporting tab, set the password for the ⪪ user in the MySQL database and enter the e-mail addresses where reports should be sent. For more information, see and .
In the Scheduled SMT Jobs tab, set a schedule of periodic ⪪ jobs, such as synchronization of updates, &ncc; registration, and ⪪ report generation. For more information, see .
If satisfied with the configuration, click OK. &yast; adjusts the ⪪ configuration and starts or restarts necessary services.
If you want to abort the configuration and cancel any changes, click Cancel.

note.para: When the ⪪ Server applies configuration changes, it checks for the existence of the common server certificate. If the certificate does not exist, you will be asked if the certificate needs to be created.

sect1.title: Activating and Deactivating ⪪ with &yast;
sect1.para: &yast; provides an easy way to activate or deactivate the ⪪ service. To activate ⪪ with &yast;, follow these steps:

step.para: Open the Customer Center Access tab of the ⪪ Server .
Check the Enable Subscription Management Tool service (SMT) option.

note.para: If not already configured, mirroring credentials should be configured before activating ⪪. For more information about how to set mirroring credentials with &yast;, see .

step.para: Click Finish to apply the changes and leave the ⪪ Server.

sect1.para: To deactivate ⪪ with &yast;, follow these steps:

step.para: Open the Customer Center Access tab of the ⪪ Server.
Uncheck the Enable Subscription Management Tool service (SMT) option.
Click Finish to apply the changes and leave the ⪪ Server .

sect1.para: When activating ⪪, the following important operations are performed by &yast;:

listitem.para: The Apache configuration is changed by creating symbolic links in the /etc/apache2/conf.d/ directory. Links to the /etc/smt.d/nu_server.conf and /etc/smt.d/smt_mod_perl.conf files are created there.
The Apache Web server is started (or reloaded if already running).
The MySQL server is started (or reloaded if already running). The smt user and all necessary tables in the database are created as needed.
The schema of the ⪪ database is checked. If the database schema is obsolete, the ⪪ database is upgraded to conform to the current schema.
Cron is adjusted by creating a symbolic link in the /etc/cron.d/ directory. A link to the /etc/smt.d/novell.com-smt file is created there.

sect1.para: When deactivating ⪪, the following important operations are performed by &yast;:

listitem.para: Symbolic links created upon ⪪ activation in the /etc/apache2/conf.d/ and /etc/cron.d/ directories are deleted.
The Cron, Apache Web and MySQL servers are reloaded. Neither Apache nor MySQL are stopped, because they may be used for other purposes than the ⪪ service.

sect1.title: Setting ν Credentials with &yast;
sect1.para: &yast; provides an interface to set and test ν credentials and the URL of the ν service. To do so, follow these steps:

step.para: Open the Customer Center Access tab of the ⪪ Server Configuration (NU Configuration). If the credentials have been already set with &yast; or the /etc/smt.conf configuration file, they appear in the dialog. Otherwise, the User and Password fields are blank.
If you do not have your credentials, visit &ncc; to obtain them. For more details, see .
Enter your ν username in User and the corresponding password in Password.

Press Test to check the credentials. &yast; will try to download a list of available repositories with the provided
credentials. If the test succeeds, the last line of the test results will read Test result: success. If the test fails, check the provided
credentials and try again.
Enter the NCC E-mail Used for Registration. This should be the address you used to register to &ncc;.
Enter Your SMT Server URL if it has not been detected automatically.
Press OK or continue with other configurations.

sect1.title: Setting ⪪ Database Password with &yast;
sect1.para: For security reasons, ⪪ uses its own user in the database. &yast; provides an interface for setting up or changing the ⪪ database password. To set or change the ⪪ database password with &yast;, follow these steps:

step.para: Open the Database and Reporting tab of the ⪪ Server Configuration module.
Enter the ⪪ Database Password for ⪪ User. Confirm the password by reentering it and press OK, or continue with other configurations.

sect1.title: Setting E-mail Addresses to Receive Reports with &yast;
sect1.para: &yast; ⪪ provides an interface for setting up a list of e-mail addresses to which ⪪ reports will be sent. To edit this list of addresses, follow these steps:

step.para: Open the Database and Reporting tab of the ⪪ Server Configuration.
The list of e-mail addresses is shown in the table. You can Add, Edit, or Delete addresses with the relevant buttons.
Press OK or continue with other configurations.

sect1.para: The comma-separated list of adresses for ⪪ reports is written to the reportEmail option of the /etc/smt.conf configuration file.

sect1.title: Setting the ⪪ Job Schedule with &yast;
sect1.para: The ⪪ Server Configuration module provides an interface to schedule periodical ⪪ jobs. &yast; uses cron to schedule configured jobs. If needed, cron can be used directly. Five types of periodical jobs can be set:

listitem.para: Synchronizes with &ncc;, updates repositories, and downloads new updates.
Generates and sends ⪪ Subscription Reports to addresses defined in .
Registers all clients to &ncc; that are not already registered or that changed their data since the last registration.
Cleans up queued jobs. It will remove finished or failed jobs from the job queue that are older than 8 days and remove job artifacts that remained in the database as result of an error.
Uploads support configs, only when the ⪪-support package is installed and manually added. To add it, click Add, then select Uploads Support Configs from the Job to Run list.

sect1.para: To configure the schedule of ⪪ jobs with &yast;, follow these steps:

step.para: Open the Scheduled SMT Jobs tab of the ⪪ Server Configuration. The table contains a list of all scheduled jobs, their type, frequency, date, and time to run. You can add, delete or edit these scheduled events.
If you want to add a scheduled ⪪ job, press Add. The Adding New SMT Scheduled Job dialog opens.
Choose the synchronization job to schedule. You can choose between Synchronization of Updates, Report Generation, NCC Registration, Job Queue Cleanup, and Uploading Support Configs.
Choose the Frequency of the new scheduled ⪪ job. Jobs can be performed Daily, Weekly, Monthly, or Periodically (every n-th hour or every m-th minute).
Set the Job Start Time by entering Hour and Minute. In case of periodical frequency, enter the relevant periods. For weekly and monthly schedules, select Day of the Week or Day of the Month.
Press Add.
If you want to edit a scheduled ⪪ job (for example, change its frequency, time, or date), select the job in the table and press Edit. Then change the desired parameters and press OK.
If you want to cancel a scheduled job and delete it from the table, select the job in the table and press Delete.
Press OK to apply the settings and quit the ⪪ Server Configuration, or continue with other configurations.
